title: Minecraft server.jar command-line arguments
description:
The server.jar is the jar file to execute with java to start Minecraft server.
https://minecraft.wiki/w/Tutorial:Setting_up_a_Java_Edition_server#Server_options

--bonusChest.description:
Enable the bonus chest[1] when generating a world for the first time.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Bonus_chest

--demo.description:
Enable demo mode[1]. Shows the players a demo pop-up, and players cannot break or place blocks after the 5 in-game days demo time has expired, even if they have purchased the game.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Demo_mode

--eraseCache.description:
Erase cached data like light levels and biome data, which must then be regenerated. Equivalent to the "Erase Cached Data" option of "Optimize World" in World Options[1] on the client.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/World_Options

--forceUpgrade.description:
Optimize the world by upgrading the level data to the latest format[1]. Once the world is optimized, it is no longer compatible with older level formats. Equivalent to the "Optimize World" option in World Options[2] on the client.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Java_Edition_level_format
[2]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/World_Options

--help.description: Print available options without starting the server.

--initSettings.description:
Initialize `server.properties`[1] and `eula.txt` without starting the server. If either file is missing, it creates them with default values.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Server.properties

--jfrProfile.description:
Initialize Java Flight Recorder[1] profiler for the server. While the server is running, the profiler can be opened using an external tool or software, such as VisualVM[2]. It enables monitoring of the server's CPU, memory, and threads usage. Additionally, it saves a `jfr` file on the `debug` folder of the `server.jar`, containing JVM and operating system events, and several Minecraft-related custom events. Further information on Commands/jfr ยง Usage[3].

[1]:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_Flight_Recorder
[2]:https://visualvm.github.io/
[3]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Commands/jfr#Usage

--nogui.description:
Disable GUI[1] when launching the server.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Tutorial:Setting_up_a_Java_Edition_server#Interface

--pidFile <Path>.description:
Create a text file at path containing the process identifier[1] (PID) of the server process while it's running.

[1]:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/process_identifier

--port <Integer>.description: Specify the TCP port to use instead of the value in `server.properties`.

--recreateRegionFiles.description: Optimize the world similar to --forceUpgrade, but also rewrites all the chunks independently of whether they have been upgraded, creating a fresh and defragmented region files. Using this option after changing `region-file-compression` in `server.properties` will recompress all region files in the new format.

--safeMode.description: Ensure the server only loads the vanilla datapack.

--serverId <String>.description:
Specify the "Server Id" string used in the crash[1] report details.

[1]:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Crash

--universe <String>.description: Specify the path to the directory `level-name` in `server.properties` is relative to. If empty, it is relative to the working directory.

--world <String>.description: Specify the world name to use instead of the `level-name` value in `server.properties`.
